cold_snaps.status: No cold snap is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference remains 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall to date occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 27.64mm over the 15.9 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge occurred on 03 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 2.0 hour storm when 7.99mm of rain fell.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 when 24.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 6.4mm per hour.
Currently clear skies.  The most recent storm happened on 03 September 2025 and it persisted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (190°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 66.24 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.5°C) and outside temperature (down 3.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 10922 lux), pressure (down 6 mbar), cloud levels (up 193 m), and rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 14222 lux), cloud levels (up 1661 m), and rainfall (down 0.8 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 193.2m lower than yesterday, 556.4m lower than the past week, 1661.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 565m and a peak of 1838m, averaging 917.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Moderate rainfall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
